results.title: Assert at work
results.brief_description: Being assertive isn’t about speaking loudly or aggressively. It isn’t about bullying or winning. It’s about standing up for your rights without violating the rights of others. It’s about striving to achieve a “Win-win” situation. In twenty-two brief episodes we are shown eleven verbal manoeuvres and how to combat them, using four key assertion skills - regaining and holding your ground, being specific, sticking to it, and fielding responses.

results.title: Assembly tools
results.brief_description: Features the methods for mounting various types of components and demonstrates different methods of attaching leads through the board. Shows correct orientation of components and suggestions for handling sensitive components.

results.title: Assault on the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Ross Mackenzie, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The story of a CSIRO program in which a black weevil was introduced into New Guinea’s Sepik River in an attempt to control one of the world’s worst water weeds, Salvinia molesta. Narrated by John Stanton.

results.title: Assault on the Land
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rob Gell’s environment series”.
Examines the problems of salinity, showing how it affects not only the farmers, but all of us. Several methods currently in use to combat the problems are examined in areas of Victoria.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, J Kaplan and CKK Corporation
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.

results.title: Assault on human dignity
results.brief_description: An IFAG report by Kurt Bethge which investigates to political maneuvering in the Soviet occupied zone of Germany which led to the erection of the Berlin Wall, and how this affected the people in West Berlin, when world attention was focussed on those in East Berlin.
results.description: An IFAG report by Kurt Bethge which investigates to political maneuvering in the Soviet occupied zone of Germany which led to the erection of the Berlin Wall, and how this affected the people in West Berlin, when world attention was focussed on those in East Berlin.

results.title: Assassins d'eau douce (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Painleve and Comptoir Francais du Film Documentaire
results.brief_description: A study of the life of carnivorous freshwater larvae, with interesting jazz background music. Commentary in French. Was awarded the first prize in its section at the 1947 Brussels Film Festival.

results.title: Assassination at Sarajevo: pretext for war
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, John Sharnik and CBS News
results.brief_description: This film discusses how the chain of events following the death of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Serbia, allowed Austria to seek revenge and precipitate the outbreak of World War I. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiatry students.

results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton, Leo McCarthy and B C M Productions
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.

results.title: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag
results.brief_description: Assassin’s Creed IV Black Flag begins in 1715, when pirates established a lawless republic in the Caribbean and ruled the land and seas. These outlaws paralyzed navies, halted international trade, and plundered vast fortunes. They threatened the power structures that ruled Europe, inspired the imaginations of millions, and left a legacy that still endures.

constellations_other.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_other.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

results.description: Into this world sails a young, cocky, and fearsome captain named Edward Kenway. His skill with a sword and disdain for authority earn him the respect of pirate legends like Blackbeard, but thrust him into an ancient conflict that threatens to destroy everything the pirates have built.
